text:
1. Find 1-2 themes that someone can build with and fits 90% of your needs 
2. Find a dev (contractor or internal) that can fill the 10%

Reminder: Did you know you can message <@U02162GK9SP|sprocky> at any time to get HubSpot development questions answered? It’s an experimental chat bot built to tackle developer questions. It won’t read your code, but can answer a lot of questions about building on the HubSpot platform.

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report.a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hi all,

I am looking at pushing data into HubSpot from our main system as a custom object, These will be one (Org) to many (Custom object). However I want to be able to associate that object with an organisation. From what I've seen, I can do that as a second call but I need to know the HubSpot ID of the organisation.

What I really want, is to be able to associate the custom object with an organisation automatically, or at a second choice, be able to create the association using a defined field (internal org ID) rather than the HubSpot ID. I guess I can fetch and then push based off the HubSpot ID, but that makes this a much larger piece of work.

Am I missing something obvious here?
To do the automatic associate you could just setup a workflow to to do the association (using a field on the custom object) whenever a object is created
this field could just lookup the id for the object and then associate the 2 objects together
all of this would be done in custom code, not too much work and would definitely dave you a lot of headache in the future
ahh right, that might do it, I'll have a look!

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
I’m still seeing this (see image) in HubSpot. Is there any way to check what it might be referring to / detecting?
It means you are connecting HubSpot to another endpoint using the API key.
Right. But are there any easy ways to debug this / figure out where? We believe the migration from API keys is done.
Should be listed under the private apps tab under integrations. At least that is were I see my API usage.
:point_up:might need HubSpot support here too
Alright, thanks! I’ll talk to my super admin first and see if we might need further HubSpot support here.

You can still see the logs for hapikeys so I would suggest checking there, you might not even have an app accessing HubSpot through a hapikey but you just haven't deleted the key yet and HubSpot is worried

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Is anyone else still getting this banner even though they have inactivated their API Key? We have been getting this banner this week even though we deactivated the key last week...
Woop! My workflows are all scheduled too close together. Sorry for the onslaught of Slack tips and tricks, all! Will adjust.

Hello All, I am facing an issue regarding HubSpot to CRM Dynamics 365 integration. The issue is in accessing HubSpot link within PowerApps form. However, we could see there are cookies in the traffic that is blocking the access. We would like to know how to resolve this issue. I have already removed the extension from browser. But still can see the same error in dynamics 365.
did you delete the hapikey or just swap it out for private apps
<@U01QVR44MEY>-- We used the private app to generate a bearer token and deactivated our API Key after switching out the authorization for our integrations.
and just to double check you have refreshed the page

Anybody have any guess how to set the `hs_quote_total_preference` property? Dev docs say

```hs_quote_total_preference: set based on your account settings. If you haven't configured this setting, it will default to the value of the total_first_payment field.```
All sounds great except that `total_first_payment` field is suddenly ZERO for every deal with a custom payment date.

We've been using the custom quotes module for a long time and it just keeps having these releases where suddenly core functionality is broken.
<@U01QVR44MEY> Yeah -- each morning it shows up again.

For additional context:

```totals={subtotals={}, total=0, total_first_payment=0, total_contract_value=13900.0}```
This is the totals object inside associated_objects.

We do NOT use HubSpot payments or stripe, we don't collect payments on our quotes, but if we do set a payment provider, at least in the quote preview, suddenly the totals get fixed.

Seems like somebody forgot to test what happens on templates when the customer is NOT using any payment providers (aka the default for the last decade)

Also... Now every AE is seeing this. It isn't MISSING because we never put it in and didn't want it and won't use HubSpot for payments because it has too many missing features.

What PM thought it was a good idea to advise sales people to `Contact your admin` because we haven't adopted a new unwanted feature? HubSpot traditionally notifies super admins of these types of things, is the new PLG motion on enterprise contracts that we should expect HubSpot to harass our employees with misinformation?

It's this kind of unreliability and lack of professionalism in production environments that has our team looking at a CPQ tool... HubSpot isn't perfect by any stretch, and we don't expect it to be, but we just keep seeing this kind of weird behavior on quotes, stuff breaks, lack of testing, now harassing employees to try and get admins to adopt new features.
Also, good times... there is no account setting that indicates that it would control the quote total.
Just so infuriating that we can change literally nothing and stuff breaks every 3-6 months.

Greetings.  Just curious if any call recording experts that I could chat with.  We are onboarding and someone wants all calls recorded.   Wondering what other companies are doing in this situation when have systems already in place.

I spoke with a sales person at <http://DialPad.com|DialPad.com> and they said incoming calls are recorded but if you look at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/calling-sdk> this clearly says "Please note: only outgoing calls are currently supported."
That only outbound calls mean you can't receive call in HubSpot with a custom calling extension
you can now receive call with the default HubSpot calling add on though
Yeah it can definitely be a little frustrating I've found myself in the same situation a couple of times with the quotes product
definitely not a fully finished tool and the team knows that, they are working on making it better every day. Thanks for pointing out things like this.
That is what staging environments & beta testers are for. This is no longer a beta product.
true true
not saying you're wrong
It's not like HubSpot is a startup, they are multi billion dollars publicly traded company :slightly_smiling_face:
lol: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PJ878V/p1676651965675139>

That tool has been in limbo for a little bit, could go a couple of different directions in the future. I honestly don't think anyone at HubSpot knows for sure yet what that tool is going to look like in 5 years
